header.h1: Superintendent Update: School Closure - Week of March 30th!

span.content: Superintendent Update: School Closure - Week of March 30th!

div.p: Dear Parents, Families and School Community Members,Â
I wanted to reach out briefly on a few items,Â and alsoÂ to take a moment to celebrate!Â First a few items of "Business"...Â
div.h3: Satellite Lunch Program -Â OperationÂ Feed SEBRSD!Â
div.p: As everyone knows we are one of only a fewÂ local schoolÂ districtsÂ west of Worcester providingÂ Free Meals forÂ ALL StudentsÂ within the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District.Â The schedule for the week of April 3rdÂ through 10th, 2020Â ncludesÂ theÂ followingÂ locations and times.Â
In Spencer, MA (10:30am â 11:15am)Â

ul.li: Mary Queen of theÂ RosaryÂ ChurchÂ (Parking Lot)Â atÂ 60Â MapleÂ StreetÂ
RichardÂ SugdenÂ LibraryÂ (Rear of Building) atÂ 8 Pleasant StreetÂ

div.p: In East Brookfield MA (11:30am â 12:15pm)Â

ul.li: East BrookfieldÂ BaptistÂ ChurchÂ (Parking Lot) atÂ 262 East Main StreetÂ

div.p: In Spencer, MA (12:15pm â 12:30pm)

ul.li: 9 Bixby Road Hosing Development âÂ NEW LOCATIONÂ (This location is for residents only).Â

ol.li: Drive Up and Let us know how many meals youÂ wouldÂ like.Â
Staff will provide you with the appropriate number of meals.Â
Drive off and have aÂ nutritiousÂ day!Â

p.strong: IMPORTANT:Â The âGrab and Goâ Meals Program will not be in operation during the week of April Vacation, April 20 â 24.Â Â Please plan accordingly.Â

div.p: Faculty and staff willÂ begin directing students at all grade levels and in each middle and high school courseÂ with weekly assignments beginning Monday, March 30. Please refer to SEBRSD'sÂ Remote LearningÂ WebsiteÂ to view your students' specific school assigned learning opportunities each week. The site can be found on the Internet by searchingÂ seb-remote-learning. Addition suggestions for supporting students' remote learning can be viewed from ourÂ Student Services webpageÂ or ourÂ Student Services information bulletin.Â

In addition to the weekly guided assignments, the following are some quick guidelines for continuing to learn and grow as a scholar during these weeks of school disruption. Many general resources are websites or other online tools that can be accessed fromÂ computers,Â mobile phones, tablets, online gaming systems (Xbox, Nintendo, ... etc).Â For some sites you will need yourÂ username and password to log in and use the resources, others are freely accessible to everyone.Â Â More resources are being brought forward daily thanks to the outstanding efforts of our faculty, staff and students as well as our leadership team.Â So, please check back often for more learning opportunities as they become available.Â
Â
April Vacation:Â As noted above, it is my recommendation to cease ALL operations within the regional school district for the week of April 20thÂ - 24th, 2020.Â I will be making this recommendation based upon several factors...

ul.li: First and foremost, the safety and health of everyone concerned as we enter the height of the pandemic.Â
Second,Â many of our studentsâ families are working harder than ever trying to maintain homes and jobs while learning how to help educate their own children.Â

Third, I am equally concerned that this pandemic has taxed our operational capacity and resources to the brink of exhaustion as many of our faculty and staff membersÂ have been attempting to juggle teaching and learning while helping their own children with their studies, and all while trying to maintain a household which often includes a spouse working from home.Â Â Â

div.p: I want to make clear that I am extremely proud of our students and their families.Â I am equally proud of our entire faculty, staff and administrative âLeadershipâ team for all their combined efforts "to keep teaching and learning alive for our entire regional school district!"Â IÂ have personally âparticipated inâ many Zoom or Google meetings.Â And while this in no way takes the place ofÂ what teaching and learning used to be prior to March 13th, 2020 and the closure of our regional school district, please knowÂ we miss our students very â VERY - much.Â Â In brief, we are using the time during April vacation to recharge and get ready and prepared for the final leg of this marathon.

Moreover, I have another reason to be proud ofÂ our faculty, staff, administration and students beyond the remote learning opportunities taking place within our district.Â Despite being advised by the MA Department of Elementary and Secondary Education - to write a âMemorandum of Agreement (MoA)â between the district and the union leadership, we have attempted to navigate this unprecedented pandemic and closure without such an agreement by keeping the lines of communication open and remaining committed to focus upon teaching and learning â together â for our students and ourÂ community!Â And to be clear, I amÂ proud andÂ pleased because our collective efforts â together - have exceeded theÂ Remote Learning GuidelinesÂ provided by DESE; and speak to the professionalism and pride every employee takes in our work!Â In summary, ourÂ MoAÂ is to continue "to communicate and adjust our sails according to the needs of our students, parents and families as best we can with what weÂ haveÂ throughout this closure."

Right now, we know all schools and our Central Office operations will be closed throughout the month of April.Â No one knows if we will open in early May.Â I know there are lots of questions, and concerns around theÂ topic of when we will re-open our doors again.Â As final decisions are made, I will keep you informed - so please stay tuned.Â

All schools and school-related activities in the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District are closed and cancelled from March 16 â May 1, 2020.Â The information detailed in thisÂ Frequently Asked QuestionsÂ (FAQ) document is intended to provide guidance for this period. It is important to note that this is a fluid situation and so this document will be regularly updated and modified, and it is recommended that you revisit frequently for the latest updates and information.Â

Of course, a statement like the one above leads one to ask, "How do you know for sure?"Â Because we areÂ sharingÂ the âgood stuffâ throughÂ pictures, drawings, and letters created by our students and families.Â As mentioned in anÂ earlierÂ Superintendent Update, if families want to take pictures of their students remote learning online, I'd love to have them share!Â Please continueÂ usingÂ theÂ hashtagÂ #SEBRSDLearnsTogetherÂ andÂ #WeGotThisÂ would be awesome if folks want to post pictures on twitter and use that hashtag and go ahead and loop me in @ChooseSEBRSDÂ or my personal twitter accountÂ @pshaughey.Â I would love to see them and re-tweet and maybe even share on Facebook site too!Â Let's do what we do bestÂ -Â CELEBRATE THE GOOD!Â

I am so proud to be the Superintendent of Schools for the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District for so many reasons... One of the main reasons I am so proud rests with our students, our staff; and our communities; is the fact that together âÂ âWe Got This!âÂ Â Â As always, thank you for your continued partnership and support of the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District!!Â Â #Progress #Unity #KnowledgeÂ
Stay safe.Â Stay Healthy and Stay Home.
Sincerely Yours,Â
Superintendent of SchoolsÂ
